CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 25, 1957, pg. A14 reads: "Debs Dance - A scene of beauty and youth was that pictured here when the 17 lovely young girls did their special dance, weaving in and out with gaily colored ribbons, during the 1957 AKA Debutante Cotillion. The scene was set in the Pittsburgh Room of the Penn-Sheraton Hotel. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of debutantes, including Alice Jean Weatherly on left, holding ribbons while dancing in circle during the Alpha Kappa Alpha 1957 Cotillion in Penn Sheraton Hotel
